description: Marriage as quantum superposition. Same state, two readings. Neither is more real.

lines: and something holds that should have broken
top_poems.text:
your hand finds mine
and something holds that should have broken
still, your warmth

lines: I trace the atlas of your changing face
top_poems.text:
your hand finds mine
I trace the atlas of your changing face
still, your warmth

lines: and something stays that should have left by now
top_poems.text:
your silence fills the room
and something stays that should have left by now
still, your weight

lines: and something stays that should have left by now
top_poems.text:
seventeen years of this
and something stays that should have left by now
crumbs on the table

lines: the years have worn us thin as excuses
top_poems.text:
your silence fills the room
the years have worn us thin as excuses
still, your weight

lines: and something holds that should have broken
top_poems.text:
your hand finds mine

lines: the ordinary days are what I'll grieve
top_poems.text:
I know your silences
the ordinary days are what I'll grieve
the long way home
